member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.IClock
member.summary: An abstraction of the ability to determine the current date and time.
member.remarks: This interface primarily exists for testing purposes, allowing test code to isolate itself from the system clock. In production, the implementation is by far the most likely one to be used, and the only one provided within this library. Code that uses a clock should generally be designed to allow it to be optionally specified, defaulting to .

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.IClock.GetCurrentDateTimeUtc
member.summary: Returns the current date and time in UTC, with a kind of .
member.returns: A representing the current date and time in UTC.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.IScheduler
member.summary: Abstraction of scheduler-like operations, used for testability.
member.remarks: Note that this is different to , which is really involved with assigning tasks to threads rather than any sort of delay.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.IScheduler.Delay(System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns a task which will complete after the given delay. Whether the returned awaitable is configured to capture the current context or not is implementation-specific. (A test implementation may capture the current context to enable reliable testing.)
member.param: Time to delay for. Must not be negative.
The cancellation token that will be checked prior to completing the returned task.
member.returns: A task which will complete after the given delay.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.SchedulerExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for .

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.SchedulerExtensions.Sleep(Google.Api.Gax.IScheduler,System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Simulates a synchronous delay by calling on , and unwrapping any exceptions generated (typically cancellation).
member.param: The scheduler to use for the sleep operation.
Time to sleep for. Must not be negative.
The cancellation token that will be watched during the sleep operation.
member.exception: The cancellation token was cancelled during the sleep.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.Page`1
member.summary: A page of resources which will only have fewer results than requested if there is no more data to fetch.
member.typeparam: The type of resource within the page.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Page`1.NextPageToken
member.summary: The page token to use to fetch the next set of resources.
member.remarks: gRPC-based APIs use an empty string as a "no page token", whereas REST-based APIs use a null reference instead. The value here will be consistent with the value returned by the API itself.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Page`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a fixed-size page from the given resource sequence and page token.
member.param: The resources in the page.
The next page token.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.PagedAsyncEnumerable`2
member.summary: An asynchronous sequence of resources obtained via API responses. Application code can treat this as a simple sequence (with API calls automatically being made lazily as more results are required), or call to retrieve one API response at a time, potentially with additional information.
member.typeparam: The API response type. Each response contains a page of resources.
The resource type contained within the response.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.PagedAsyncEnumerable`2.AsRawResponses
member.summary: Returns the sequence of raw API responses, each of which contributes a page of resources to this sequence.
member.returns: An asynchronous sequence of raw API responses, each containing a page of resources.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.PagedAsyncEnumerable`2.ReadPageAsync(System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously reads a single page of results with a fixed maximum size. The returned page is guaranteed to have that many results, unless there is no more data available.
member.remarks: "Natural" pages returned by the API may contain a smaller number of resources than requested. For example, a request for a page with 100 resources may return a page with 80 resources but a next page token for more to be retrieved. This is suitable for batch-processing, but not for user-visible paging such as in a web application, where fixed-size pages are expected. This method may make more than one API call in order to fill the page.
member.param: The page size. Must be greater than 0.
A token to cancel the operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous operation, the result of which is a page of resources.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.PagedEnumerable`2
member.summary: A sequence of resources obtained via API responses, each of which contributes a page of resources. Application code can treat this as a simple sequence (with API calls automatically being made lazily as more results are required), or call to retrieve a page at a time, potentially with additional information.
member.typeparam: The API response type. Each response contains a page of resources.
The resource type contained within the response.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.PagedEnumerable`2.AsRawResponses
member.summary: Returns the sequence of raw API responses, each of which contributes a page of resources to this sequence.
member.returns: A sequence of raw API responses, each containing a page of resources.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.PagedEnumerable`2.ReadPage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Asynchronously reads a single page of results with a fixed maximum size. The returned page is guaranteed to have that many results, unless there is no more data available.
member.remarks: "Natural" pages returned by the API may contain a smaller number of resources than requested. For example, a request for a page with 100 resources may return a page with 80 resources but a next page token for more to be retrieved. This is suitable for batch-processing, but not for user-visible paging such as in a web application, where fixed-size pages are expected. This method may make more than one API call in order to fill the page.
member.param: The page size. Must be greater than 0.
member.returns: An asynchronous operation, the result of which is a page of resources.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate
member.summary: Represents a path template used for resource names which may be composed of multiple IDs.

remarks.para: Templates use a subset of the syntax of the API platform. See https://github.com/googleapis/googleapis/blob/master/google/api/http.proto for details of the API platform.
This class performs no URL escaping or unescaping. It is designed for use within GRPC, where no URL encoding is required.

member.name: F:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate.s_slashSplit
member.summary: Just an array containing a single slash, to avoid constructing a new array every time we need to split.

member.name: F:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate._segments
member.summary: List of segments in this template. Never modified after construction.

member.name: F:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate._parameterSegments
member.summary: List of the segments in this template which are wildcards. Never modified after construction.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate.ParameterNames
member.summary: The names of the parameters within the template. This collection has one element per parameter, but unnamed parameters have a name of null.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a template from its textual representation, such as shelves/*/books/**.
member.param: The textual representation of the template. Must not be null.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate.ParameterCount
member.summary: The number of parameter segments (regular wildcards or path wildcards, named or unnamed) in the template.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate.ValidateServiceName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Validates a service name, ensuring it is not empty and doesn't contain any slashes. (In the future, we may want to make this stricter, e.g. that it's a valid DNS-like name.)
member.param: The name to validate
The name of the parameter

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate.ValidateResourceId(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Validate a single value from a sequence. This is used in both parsing and instantiating.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate.ValidateResourceIds(System.String[])
member.summary: Validates a whole array of resource IDs, including that the count matches.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate.Expand(System.String[])
member.summary: Validates that the given resource IDs are valid for this template, and returns a string representation

remarks.para: This is equivalent to calling new ResourceName(template, resourceIds).ToString(), but simpler in calling code and more efficient in terms of memory allocation.
This method assumes no service name is required. Call to specify a service name.

member.param: The resource IDs to use to populate the parameters in this template. Must not be null.
member.returns: The string representation of the resource name.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate.ExpandWithService(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Validates that the given resource IDs are valid for this template, and returns a string representation
member.param: The resource IDs to use to populate the parameters in this template. Must not be null.
The service name, which may be null.
member.returns: The string representation of the resource name.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate.ReplaceParameters(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the template with parameters replaced by resource IDs.
member.param: The name of the service, for full resource names. May be null, to produce a relative resource name.
Resource IDs to interpolate the template with. Expected to have been validated already.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate.TryParseName(System.String,Google.Api.Gax.TemplatedResourceName@)
member.summary: Attempts to parse the given resource name against this template, returning null on failure.
member.remarks: Although this method returns null if a name is passed in which doesn't match the template, it still throws if is null, as this would usually indicate a programming error rather than a data error.
member.param: The resource name to parse against this template. Must not be null.
When this method returns, the parsed resource name or null if parsing fails.
member.returns: true if the name was parsed successfully; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate.ParseName(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to parse the given resource name against this template, throwing on failure.
member.param: The resource name to parse against this template. Must not be null.
member.returns: The parsed name as a .

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate.TryParseNameInternal(System.String,Google.Api.Gax.TemplatedResourceName@)
member.summary: Implementation of parsing, returning the error message for a FormatException if parsing fails.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate.ToString
member.summary: Returns the textual representation of this template.
member.returns: The same textual representation that this template was initially constructed with.

member.summary: A literal path segment.

member.summary: A simple wildcard ('*').

member.summary: A path wildcard ('**').

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate.Segment
member.summary: A segment of a path.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate.Segment.Value
member.summary: The literal value or the name of a wildcard. null for unnamed wildcards.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.Polling
member.summary: Helper methods for polling scenarios.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Polling.PollRepeatedly``1(System.Func{System.Nullable{System.DateTime},``0},System.Predicate{``0},Google.Api.Gax.IClock,Google.Api.Gax.IScheduler,Google.Api.Gax.PollSettings,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Repeatedly calls the specified polling action, delaying between calls, until a given condition is met in the response.
member.typeparam: The response type. Must not be null.
member.param: The poll action, typically performing an RPC. The value passed to the action is the overall deadline, so that the RPC settings can be adjusted accordingly. A null value indicates no deadline.
The test for whether to return the response (true) or continue polling (false). Must not be null.
The clock to use for determining deadlines. Must not be null.
The scheduler to use for delaying between calls. Must not be null.
The poll settings, controlling timeouts, call settings and delays.
The cancellation token used to cancel delays, if any.
member.returns: The completed response.
member.exception: The timeout specified in the poll settings expired.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Polling.PollRepeatedlyAsync``1(System.Func{System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0}},System.Predicate{``0},Google.Api.Gax.IClock,Google.Api.Gax.IScheduler,Google.Api.Gax.PollSettings,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously repeatedly calls the specified polling action, delaying between calls, until a given condition is met in the response.
member.typeparam: The response type. Must not be null.
member.param: The poll action, typically performing an RPC. The value passed to the action is the overall deadline, so that the RPC settings can be adjusted accordingly. A null value indicates no deadline.
The test for whether to return the response (true) or continue polling (false). Must not be null.
The clock to use for determining deadlines. Must not be null.
The scheduler to use for delaying between calls. Must not be null.
The poll settings, controlling timeouts, call settings and delays.
The cancellation token used to cancel delays, if any.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation. The result of the task will be the completed response.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.PollSettings
member.summary: Settings controlling repeated polling, for example when waiting for a long-running operation to complete.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.PollSettings.Expiration
member.summary: How long to wait before giving up. This is never null.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.PollSettings.Delay
member.summary: The delay between RPC calls when fetching the operation status. This is never negative. There is no exponential backoff between calls; the same delay is used for each call.
member.remarks: This is the delay between the a successful RPC response being received and the next RPC request being sent.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.PollSettings.#ctor(Google.Api.Gax.Expiration,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates poll settings from the given expiration, delay and call settings.
member.param: The expiration to use in order to know when to stop polling. Must not be null.
The delay between RPC calls. Must be non-negative.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.ScopedCredentialProvider
member.summary: Simple factory of scoped credentials, which caches a scoped version of the default application credentials to avoid repeated authentication.

member.name: F:Google.Api.Gax.ScopedCredentialProvider._lazyScopedDefaultCredentials
member.summary: Lazily-created task to retrieve the default application channel credentials. Once completed, this task can be used whenever channel credentials are required. The returned task always runs in the thread pool, so its result can be used synchronously from synchronous methods without risk of deadlock. The same channel credentials are used by all pools. The field is initialized in the constructor, as it uses _scopes, and you can't refer to an instance field within an instance field initializer.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.ScopedCredentialProvider.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Creates a channel pool which will apply the specified scopes to the credentials if they require any.
member.param: The scopes to apply. Must not be null, and must not contain null references. May be empty.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.ScopedCredentialProvider.GetCredentials(Google.Apis.Auth.OAuth2.GoogleCredential)
member.summary: Returns credentials with the scopes applied if required.
member.param: Existing credentials, if any. This may be null, in which case the default application credentials will be used.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation. The result of the task is the scoped credentials.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.ScopedCredentialProvider.GetCredentialsAsync(Google.Apis.Auth.OAuth2.GoogleCredential)
member.summary: Asynchronously returns credentials with the scopes applied if required.
member.param: Existing credentials, if any. This may be null, in which case the default application credentials will be used.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation. The result of the task is the scoped credentials.

member.typeparam: The result type of the task

member.summary: Synchronously waits for the given task to complete. Any thrown is unwrapped to the first inner exception.
member.param: The task to wait for.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.TemplatedResourceName
member.summary: Class for representing and working with resource names.

remarks.para: A resource name is represented by a , an assignment of resource IDs to parameters in the template, and an optional service name. This class allows the service name and resource IDs to be modified, but only within the same template.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.TemplatedResourceName.Template
member.summary: The template this resource name is associated with. Never null.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.TemplatedResourceName.ServiceName
member.summary: The service name part of this resource name, or null if no service name is specified.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.TemplatedResourceName.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the identifier for the specified parameter index.
member.param: The index of the parameter value to retrieve.
member.returns: The identifier within the resource name at the given parameter index.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.TemplatedResourceName.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets the identifier for the specified parameter name.
member.param: The name of the parameter value to retrieve.
member.returns: The identifier within the resource name with the given parameter name.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.TemplatedResourceName.#ctor(Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate,System.String[])
member.summary: Creates a resource name with the given template and resource IDs. The resource IDs are cloned, so later changes to are ignored. This constructor does not populate the property, but that can be set after construction.
member.param: The template for the new resource name. Must not be null.
The resource IDs to populate template parameters with. Must not be null.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.TemplatedResourceName.Clone
member.summary: Creates a clone of this resource name, which is then independent of the original.
member.returns: A clone of this resource name.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.TemplatedResourceName.#ctor(Google.Api.Gax.PathTemplate,System.String,System.String[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Private constructor used by internal code to avoid repeated cloning and validation.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.TemplatedResourceName.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this resource name, expanding the template parameters with the resource IDs and prepending the service name (if present).
member.returns: A string representation of this resource name.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.UnknownResourceName
member.summary: A resource name in which nothing is known about the name structure.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.UnknownResourceName.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parse a resource name into an . Only minimal verification is carried out that is a value resource name string.
member.param: A resource name.
member.returns: An representing the given string.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.UnknownResourceName.TryParse(System.String,Google.Api.Gax.UnknownResourceName@)
member.summary: Tries to parse the given resource name into an . Only minimal verification is carried out that is a value resource name string.
member.param: A resource name.
The result if parsing is successful, otherwise null.
member.returns: true if was successfully parsed, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.UnknownResourceName.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an unkown resource name from the given resource name string. Only minimal verification is carried out that is a value resource name string.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.VersionHeaderBuilder
member.summary: Helps build version strings for the x-goog-api-client header. The value is a space-separated list of name/value pairs, where the value should be a semantic version string.

member.name: F:Google.Api.Gax.VersionHeaderBuilder.HeaderName
member.summary: The name of the header to set.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.VersionHeaderBuilder.AppendVersion(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Appends the given name/version string to the list.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.VersionHeaderBuilder.AppendAssemblyVersion(System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Appends a name/version string, taking the version from the version of the assembly containing the given type.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.VersionHeaderBuilder.AppendDotNetEnvironment
member.summary: Appends the .NET environment information to the list.
